message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CR, cs.SI

The paper proposes a hybrid approach for approximate inference and parameter learning using classical methods and amortized variational inference. This approach is applied to the Noisy-OR model, which is a probabilistic graphical model commonly studied in machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CL (Computation and Language) as they are also relevant to probabilistic graphical models. The paper also discusses the effectiveness of the proposed approach in terms of computational complexity and accuracy, which suggests that it may be relevant to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
